Overview

The Vendor Managed Inventory (VMI) API allows Vendors to automate inventory management. VMI provides a communication mechanism with RQ clients to report on product inventory and to create purchase orders to replenish products. RQ users will be able to see the purchase orders created using VMI API and receive them as they arrive in store.

Note: RetailiQ is the legacy retail management system produced by iQmetrix, and has been replaced by RQ. In this document, RetailiQ and RQ are used synonymously.

The VMI API uses different Authentication than other iQmetrix APIs. The credentials are assigned to you by iQmetrix and included in the body of the SOAP request. To request credentials, contact Support.

The Vendor Managed Inventory (VMI) API can be used to:

  • Create and retrieve Purchase Orders (POs) created in RQ
  • Create shipping notices for POs
  • See a list of all VMI enabled stores in RQ
  • Enable and Disable companies for VMI

Endpoints

  • Sandbox: https://vmirc.iqmetrix.net/VMIService.asmx
  • Production (Denver): https://vmi1.iqmetrix.net/VMIService.asmx
  • Production (Toronto): https://vmi3.iqmetrix.net/VMIService.asmx
  • Production (Philadelphia): https://vmi10.iqmetrix.net/VMIService.asmx
Important: You should choose a production endpoint that is geographically closest to your data center

Resources

VendorIdentity

Authentication for the VMI API is done by including a VendorIdentity resource in a <vendor> section at the beginning of each request.

VendorIdentitiy information is supplied by iQmetrix and used to authenticate requests made to the VMI API.

Note: Please be aware of the subtle difference between <vendor> and <Vendor> in the various requests. This API is case-sensitive and will cause an error should the incorrect tag be used.
Note: VendorIdentity authentication information is Environment specific
Name Data Type Description Example
VendorID GUID Vendor identifier 9DC6AA95-856B-42C9-8AAF-392A2A02AC77
Username String Username sampleusername
Password String Password samplepassword
ClientAgent ClientAgent Client identity  

ClientAgent

VendorAccountNumber can be used instead of StoreID. Omit or set StoreID to -1 if using VendorAccountNumber.

Name Data Type Description Example
ClientID GUID Database identifier for corresponding client c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4
Name String Company name DropshipTestDemo
StoreId Integer Store identifer the vendor is targeting 4
VendorAccountNumber String Account number assigned by vendor. -1

CompanyInformation

Name Data Type Description Example
CompanyID GUID Unique identifier provided by iQmetrix of a Company in RQ 9DC6AA95-856B-42C9-8AAF-392A2A02AC77
Name String Company name DropshipTestDemo

ProductItemID Integer GlobalProductId from RQ 11142
Quantity Integer Number of items shipped 1
RQPurchaseOrderID Integer Identifier for the Purchase Order in RQ 22073
SerialNumbers Array[string] Serial numbers from serialized products (e.g. Phone or SIM card) 490154203237518
ShipmentNumber String Vendor defined identifier for the shipment SHIP001
VendorInvoiceNumber String Value supplied by the vendor when creating the purchase order 1002
VendorSKU String The vendor part number/sku SSGS5CB

Requests

Getting Pending Companies

Retrieves a list of all companies that are in a Pending state for the Vendor. This means that the company has completed setup within RQ, chosen the vendor, added stores to the relationship, and configured product for replenishment.

Vendors can only create purchase orders for Enabled companies. To change the status of a company, use Enabling or Disabling a Company .

Request

POST /?op=GetPendingCompanies

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Optional)
      • ClientID (Optional)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 4

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; VMIServiceSoapClient vmiService = new VMIServiceSoapClient(); CompanyInformation[] companies = vmiService.GetPendingCompanies(vendor);

```

Response

CompanyInformation

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo_DansSupplies ...

```

Getting Enabled Companies

Retrieves a list of VMI enabled companies.

Request

POST /?op=GetEnabledCompanies

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Optional)
      • ClientID (Optional)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 4

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; VMIServiceSoapClient vmiService = new VMIServiceSoapClient(); CompanyInformation[] companies = vmiService.GetEnabledCompanies(vendor);

```

Response

CompanyInformation

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo_DansSupplies ...

```

Enabling or Disabling a Company

Change the interaction status of a company. By enabling a company, it will be visible when Getting Enabled Companies is called.

Only enabled companies may receive purchase orders through the VMI service.

Request

POST /?op=EnableCompany

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Required)
      • ClientID (Required)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)

Request Parameters

  • isEnabled (Optional) - True to enable, if not specified defaults to false
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 14070 true

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; vendor.Client = new ClientAgent(); vendor.Client.ClientID = companyID; vmiService.EnableCompany(vendor, true); // false to disable a company

```

Response

Returns a null response.

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

```

Getting a Company List

Retrieves a list of VMI enabled companies.

Request

POST /?op=GetCompanyList

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • Vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Optional)
      • ClientID (Optional)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 4

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; VMIServiceSoapClient vmiService = new VMIServiceSoapClient(); CompanyInformation[] companies = vmiService.GetCompanyList(vendor);

```

Response

CompanyInformation

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo_DansSupplies ...

```

Getting a Store List

Retrieves a list of VMI enabled stores.

Request

POST /?op=GetStoreList

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • Vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Required)
      • ClientID (Required)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 4

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; vendor.Client = new ClientAgent(); vendor.Client.ClientID = companyID;

StoreInformation[] stores = vmiService.GetStoreList(vendor);

```

Response

StoreInformation

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

4 Tasha's Test Location TT101 First Region First District
845 Rue Sherbrooke O
Montréal QC H3A 0G4 Canada 4215551234 4 4 -1 ...

```

Getting an Inventory Report

Retrieves an inventory of products for which the vendor is set as the primary vendor in RQ.

Request

POST /?op=GetInventoryReport

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • Vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Required)
      • ClientID (Required)
      • Name (Optional)
      • StoreID (Required)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)

Request Parameters

  • StartDate (Required)
  • EndDate (Required)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 4 01/01/2016 10/31/2016

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; vendor.Client = new ClientAgent(); vendor.Client.ClientID = companyID;

vendor.Client.StoreID = 4; ProductInformation[] productReport = vmiService.GetInventoryReport(vendor, startDate, endDate);

```

Response

ProductInformation

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 ACCRTM000001 SSGS5CB 17 Activations >> Samsung Samsung Galaxy S5 - Charcoal Black 100 10 100 8 3 0 0 1 1 0 0 -1 8 0 0 3 2 01/21/2016 16:58:23 false false true false 2016-06-01T00:00:00 685 550 2016-04-11T00:00:00 2016-04-15T00:00:00 ...

```

Creating a Purchase Order

Allows the vendor to create a purchase order for a particular store and a set of products. This allows RQ to properly account for products arriving at a store so that stock levels are updated correctly. You must be marked as the Primary Vendor in RQ to add a product to a Purchase Order.

Request

POST /?op=CreatePurchaseOrder

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Required)
      • ClientID (Required)
      • StoreID (Required)
      • Name (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)

Request Parameters

  • PurchaseOrder (Required) - the PurchaseOrder
    • PurchaseOrderID (Required)
    • PurchaseOrderData (Required)
      • BillToStoreID (Required) - defaults to -1
      • EstimatedArrivalDate (Required)
      • ShipToStoreID (Required) - defaults to -1
      • VendorInvoiceNumber (Required)
      • Comments (Optional)
      • CreatedByVMI (Optional) - defaults to false
      • CreatedDate (Optional)
      • OrderTotal (Optional) - defaults to -1
      • ShippingTotal (Optional) - defaults to -1
    • ProductsOrdered (Required)
      • ProductInformation (Required)
        • QuantityOrdered (Required)
        • VendorSKU (Required)
        • ProductID (Optional)
        • ProductSKU (Optional)
        • ProductItemID (Optional)
        • ProductID (Optional)
        • ProductName (Optional)
        • MaximumLevel (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • MinimumLevel (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • ProductCost (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityInStock (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityOnOrder (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityOnBackOrder (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityInTransfer (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityOnRMA (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityOnLoan (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityCommittedOnOrderEntry (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantityReceived (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • QuantitySold (Optional) - defaults to -1
        • DateReceived (Optional)
        • ProductReceived (Optional)
        • Enabled (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 14070 4aca5c49-7efd-4ff3-8bbc-70e2fb5e1cf6 4 4 110.90 100.60 BDP123 05/10/2016 Vendor Invoice Number #: BDP123 true 2016-04-07T00:00:00 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 SSSATM000002 SSGS5CB 28 Samsung Galaxy S5 - Charcoal Black 100 10 130.00 1 2 0 1 1 0 0 20 11 12 2016-04-07T00:00:00 false true ...

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; vendor.Client = new ClientAgent(); vendor.Client.ClientID = companyID; vendor.Client.StoreID = 4;

DateTime ead1 = DateTime.Today.AddDays(14); string eta = String.Format(“{0:D2}/{1:D2}/{2:D4}”, ead1.Month, ead1.Day, ead1.Year); PurchaseOrder po = new PurchaseOrder(); po.PurchaseOrderID = new Guid(); po.PurchaseOrderData = new PurchaseOrderData(); po.PurchaseOrderData.BillToStoreID = stores[0].StoreID; po.PurchaseOrderData.Comments = “Vendor Invoice Number #: BDP123”; po.PurchaseOrderData.ShipToStoreID = stores[0].StoreID; po.PurchaseOrderData.VendorInvoiceNumber = “BDP123”; po.PurchaseOrderData.EstimatedArrivalDate = eta;

po.ProductsOrdered = new ProductInformation[1]; po.ProductsOrdered[0] = new ProductInformation(); po.ProductsOrdered[0].ProductItemID = productID; po.ProductsOrdered[0].ProductName = “Samsung Galaxy S5 - Charcoal Black”; po.ProductsOrdered[0].ProductSKU = “SSSATM000002”; po.ProductsOrdered[0].VendorSKU = “SSGS5CB”; po.ProductsOrdered[0].QuantityOrdered = 1; po.ProductsOrdered[0].ProductCost = 130.00;

PurchaseOrder poCreated = vmiService.CreatePurchaseOrder(vendor, po);

```

Response

PurchaseOrder

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

4aca5c49-7efd-4ff3-8bbc-70e2fb5e1cf6 3be54cae-b132-4995-b32b-67e6d46d9633 6 TT101PO5 4 4 110.90 100.90 DDS123 05/10/2016 Vendor Invoice Number #: DDS123 true 04/29/2016 14:54:22 false 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 SSSATM000002 SSGS5CB 28 Samsung Galaxy S5 - Charcoal Black 100 10 130.00 1 2 -1 0 1 1 0 0 -1 20 -1 -1 11 12 2016-04-07T00:00:00 false true false false 0 ...

```

Creating a Purchase Order Shipment Notice

Allows the vendor to create a shipment notice for an existing purchase order.

Notes

  • The shipment notice will be used when receiving purchase order products with serial numbers
  • Multiple shipment notices can be created for a single purchase order
  • Each shipment notice is for a single product
  • If more than one product appears in a shipment, create one shipment notice for each product, but use the same shipment number for all products in the same shipment
Tip: This request accepts an array of PurchaseOrderShipmentNotices, so you do not need to call the VMI service multiple times for products in an order

Request

POST /?op=CreatePurchaseOrderShipmentNotice

Headers

  • Content-Type: text/xml

Authorization Parameters

  • vendor (Required)
    • VendorID (Required)
    • Username (Required)
    • Password (Required)
    • Client (Required)
      • ClientID (Required)
      • StoreID (Required)
      • Name (Optional)
      • VendorAccountNumber (Optional)

Request Parameters

  • notice (Required)
    • PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice (Required) - the PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice
      • PurchaseOrderID (Required)
      • RQPurchaseOrderID (Required) - defaults to -1
      • VendorInvoiceNumber (Required)
      • ProductItemID (Optional)
      • Quantity (Optional)
      • SerialNumbers (Optional)
      • ShipmentNumber (Optional)
      • VendorSKU (Optional)
Example

```xml

009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09 danssupplies samplepassword c46ccb4d-2d44-4289-950a-b9cb51d58ac4 DropshipTestDemo 14070 bcaeea15-5a6d-4515-ba0c-70032da67e8d 28 1 22073 490154203237518 ... DSSPOSN1234 POSN1234 SSGS5CB ...

```

Code Example

```java VendorIdentity vendor = new VendorIdentity(); vendor.VendorID = new Guid(009E800D-10ED-4F4A-B86F-DFB3C2A18C09); vendor.Username = “danssupplies”; vendor.Password = “samplepassword”; vendor.Client = new ClientAgent(); vendor.Client.ClientID = companyID; vendor.Client.StoreID = -1;

PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice sn = new PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice(); sn.PurchaseOrderID = new GUID(84DACFD3-4095-4D50-A02E-781B86B7408E);

sn.ShipmentNumber = “SHIP001 “; sn.ProductItemID = 11142; sn.Quantity = 2; sn.SerialNumber = {“490154203237518”, “12321324”};

PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice snReturn = vmiService.CreatePurchaseOrderShipmentNotice(vendor, new[] { sn });

```

Response

PurchaseOrderShipmentNotice

Example

HTTP 200 Content-Type: application/xml ```xml

bcaeea15-5a6d-4515-ba0c-70032da67e8d 28 1 22073 490154203237518 ... DSSPOSN1234 POSN1234 SSGS5CB ...

```
